articles.author: Monica Alba and Dennis Romero
articles.title: Biden administration to stop sending free at-home Covid-19 tests Friday
articles.description: Without congressional funding for more kits, the government needs to conserve its stockpile in case of a fall surge of disease, the White House said.
articles.content:
The government will end its giveaway of Covid-19 at-home tests Friday because of insufficient congressional funding, a senior Biden administration official said Sunday.
A stockpile of the tests is b… [+1688 chars]

articles.author: Andrew E. Kramer
articles.title: More Strikes Reported Near Nuclear Plant as U.N. Experts Plan Visit
articles.description: Neither Russia nor Ukraine appeared to be pausing attacks in the south, even as talks continued over allowing international inspectors to visit the Zaporizhzhia power plant.
articles.content: Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant seen across the river last week from Nikopol, a Ukraine-controlled town that has been shelled recently by Russian forces.Credit...David Guttenfelder for The New York … [+3814 chars]

articles.author: Jacey Fortin, Eliza Fawcett
articles.title: How Bad Is the Teacher Shortage? Depends Where You Live.
articles.description: Urgently needed: teachers in struggling districts, certified in math or special education. Perks: maybe a pay raise, or how about a four-day week?
articles.content: Lisa Harris, an algebra teacher in the districts Patriot High School in Nokesville, said she had been teaching for 22 years and has never wanted to leave the profession. As far as teacher shortages, … [+1595 chars]

articles.title: Student loan handout reaction: People 'are getting rewarded for doing the least amount'
articles.description: Fox News Digital heard reaction from three different people to the student loan handout from the Biden administration. One person in N.J. said, "A loan is a loan. You pay it back."

articles.author: Michelle Velez and Teele Rebane, CNN
articles.title: Hundreds of children among 1,000 people killed by Pakistan monsoon rains and floods
articles.description: Severe rains and flooding have killed at least 1,033 people, including 348 children, and left 1,527 more injured in Pakistan since mid-June, officials said on Sunday.
articles.content:
(CNN)Severe rains and flooding have killed at least 1,033 people, including 348 children, and left 1,527 more injured in Pakistan since mid-June, officials said on Sunday.

articles.author: Pilar Arias
articles.title: Three Dutch soldiers shot outside hotel in Indianapolis
articles.description: Three Dutch soldiers were shot and wounded early Saturday in a shooting in downtown Indianapolis after what local police believe was a disturbance outside the hotel where they were staying, authorities said.
